intro: Melandrium friesii, commonly known as the yellow poppy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant produces striking yellow flowers with four petals, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Melandrium friesii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
